com.maddox.sas1946.il2.util

Class CrossVersion

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.maddox.sas1946.il2.util.CrossVersion

  • public class CrossVersion
extends java.lang.Object
    "CrossVersion" Class of the "SAS Common Utils"

    This Class provides helper functions for Cross Version Compatible coding of IL-2 1946 mods.

    Since:
    1.0.2
    Version:
    1.0.6
    Author:
    SAS~Storebror

    • Method Detail

      • setPrintCompassHeading

        public static final void setPrintCompassHeading(java.lang.Object obj,
                                                boolean flag)
        This helper function lets you set the "printCompassHeading" field regardless the game version your mod is running on.
        In IL-2 4.09m and earlier there was no such Field "printCompassHeading" at all.
        In IL-2 4.10m and 4.10.1m, "printCompassHeading" was a static field of the "AircraftLH" class.
        In IL-2 4.11m and later, "printCompassHeading" is a member field of the "Cockpit" class.
        This helper function deals with these version differences automatically.
        Parameters:
        obj - The Object (Aircraft or Cockpit) instance where you want to set the "printCompassHeading" field for.
        flag - defines the value which the field "printCompassHeading" will be set to.
        Since:
        1.0.2

      • setLimits6DoF

        public static final void setLimits6DoF(java.lang.Object obj,
                                       float[] limits)
        This helper function lets you set the "limits6DoF" field regardless the game version your mod is running on.
        This field was introduced with IL-2 4.11m
        Parameters:
        obj - The Cockpit instance where you want to set the "limits6DoF" field for.
        limits - The limits to apply for 6DoF
        Since:
        1.0.2

      • floatindex

        public static final float floatindex(float f,
                                     float[] af)
        This helper function compares a given float value to an array of float comparatives and returns the interpolated index position of the given float value in that array.
        A similar version exists in some but not all game versions within different classes, sometimes as static, sometimes as member function.
        Here you have it reliably in one spot.
        Parameters:
        f - The float value "f" to find the array index of.
        af - The array of float values to compare "f" to.
        Returns:
        The interpolated array index position of "f".
        Since:
        1.0.2
